title: Germany and France now publicly display their disagreements over Macron's proposals
subhead: Friedrich Merz's government has criticized the idea of a joint European loan and the push for European preference in goods purchases advocated by Emmanuel Macron. These disagreements come on top of tensions over the Mercosur trade deal and how to use frozen Russian assets.

title: Trump revokes key climate finding, dismantling legal basis for emissions rules
A business ecosystem thrives on Trump's anti-migrant policies
Former EU commissioner Thierry Breton sees himself as a savior for Europe
subhead: The French politician, a vocal critic of Ursula von der Leyen, is preparing a plan for the European Union to 'regain its sovereignty' starting in 2027.

title: In Senegal, crackdown on LGBTQ+ people intensifies
subhead: In early February, authorities in Dakar arrested 12 people accused of 'acts against nature.' Openly homophobic rhetoric has spread, while human rights defenders have been forced into silence.

title: Ultra-fast fashion giants like Shein and secondhand platforms such as Vinted disrupt France's fashion sector
subhead: In 2025, clothing sales declined by 1.6%, according to figures from the Institut Français de la Mode published on Thursday. However, the share of online sales is increasing.

title: Ice hockey at the 2026 Olympics: A mountain sport looks to win over France's big cities
subhead: The majority of players on the French national team hail from urban centers. This shift reflects the changing landscape of the sport across the country.

title: Los Angeles fires: California launches investigation into claims of late warnings in Black neighborhoods

NATO launches new Arctic defense initiative after Greenland crisis
'The decline in birth rates is a social phenomenon, not a woman's responsibility'
subhead: Instead of questioning the collective factors behind declining birth rates, the dominant narrative shifts responsibility onto women, laments Brigitte Grésy, former president of France's High Council for Gender Equality, and Micheline Misrahi-Abadou, professor at the faculty of medicine of Paris-Saclay University.

title: How Donald Trump is rewriting US history
subhead: As the country marks its 250th anniversary this year, the American president, who returned to the White House on January 20, 2025, has worked to shape a revised historical narrative, revealing signs of megalomania.

title: The Iranian protesters killed by regime gunfire on January 8
subhead: Sina Ashkbousi, Behrouz Mansouri, Mansoureh Heydari, Keyvan Moradi Mirani and Roubina Aminian were killed on the first day of protests against the Iranian regime. Their stories reflect both the diversity of the protest movement and the brutality of the crackdown.
